abstracts.cdata!:
The purpose of the Environment Impact
            Assessment is to: 1) analyze and specify environmental
            impacts; 2) examine the existing policy and legislative
            measures; and 3) prepare mitigative measures and monitoring
            plans for all adverse effects. The assessment analyzes
            positive and negative impacts on atmospheric, terrestrial,
            marine and human environments. It offers mitigation measures
            for each environment and concludes that the project has a
            positive impact on the overall environment. In addition, the
            assessment estimates the costs created by environmental
            demands and discusses institutional needs and public participation.
